Description: Digital photograph (colour); view of painted rock art projecting from a rock shelter roof; showing eight schematic human figures in faded light brown, upright and pointing either left or right, with the four on the left pointing right, and vice versa. The two leftmost are bent at the hip, the others bent at the knee with legs apart. In most cases only legs and torso are discernible. A 5cm scale marker has been fitted at the base of the image. Wadi Anak, Egypt. Scanned
Curator's comments: This site is a long, sloping shelter running up and under the protected side of an inselberg.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Trust for African Rock Art
